#summary Module "util"

= Utility module =

Defined in file `util.js`.

<font color="#aa5555">
== This module *might* get obsoleted in future ==
More specifically:
  * `serialize()` and `deserialize()` functions are already natively supported by V8, see http://wiki.ecmascript.org/doku.php?id=es3.1:json_support
  * `md5()`, `sha1()`, `base64encode()` and `base64decode` functions should be separated into a "crypto" module
  * `utf8encode()` and `utf8decode()` functions will be probably supported by Binary module
  * `mail()` should be separated into a "mail" module
</font>

  * `Util.serialize(val, [pretty])` - serializes `val` to JSON. If `pretty == true`, formatting is applied.
  * `Util.deserialize(str)` - deserializes `str` back to JS value
  * `Util.md5(str)` - calculates MD5 hash
  * `Util.sha1(str)` - calculates SHA1 hash
  * `Util.base64encode(str)` - encodes string in Base64
  * `Util.base64decode(str)` - decodes string from Base64
  * `Util.utf8decode(str)` - decodes all unicode characters into one-byte characters
  * `Util.utf8encode(str)` - encodes relevant one-byte charcater sequences into unicode characters
  * `Util.mail(to, subject, data, [additionalHeaders], [auth])` - sends an email. To perform an ESMTP authorization, set `auth` as a hash with three fields:
    * type: "login",
    * user: your user name,
    * password: your password
